title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.3 Early Child Development (ECD): EARLY LEARNING & SCHOOLREADINESS

description.narrative: 1.3 By 2022, national and sub-national government authorities enable comprehensive and developmentally appropriate early learning and school readiness, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children under 5 in targeted areas benefit from improved access to quality healthcare and nutrition, protection and development opportunities in their home, care and preschool environments.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.3 By 2022, national and sub-national government authorities enable comprehensive and developmentally appropriate early learningand school readiness

description.narrative: The priority of UNICEF’s work on early learning in 2021 was the delivery of a breadth of knowledge, experience and progressive thinking to convince the Government to push through reforms and consequential actions that meet the needs of young children by (a) commissioning a practice guide for teachers and a place-based research to improve the quality and consistency of preschool services; (b) responding to local education needs to keep children learning despite the unpredictability of COVID-19 and its ongoing impact; and (c) accelerating enhancements to a provincial preschool education management information system. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:02/02/2022
